Name: Ravi K
Title: GREAT HIDEOUT
Review: I had been to M.A. Chidambaram stadium several times.   In fact most of the match days i was there, right from Ranji Trophy to Tests, ODIs, T20s, IPL.  A wonderful stadium with cool breeze from the Sea. Marina beach is also one of the attractions. I love to watch the games from galleries and enjoy the fun with spectators including dancing, whistling, mexican wave.  Since my boyhood days, i have been going to this stadium.   Those days we use to carry Curd rice, Tamarind rice, idly etc along with friends and enjoy home food.  I still cherish the great innings played by Gundappa Viswanath in 1975 against mighty West Indies.  He scored a magnificient 97 runs unbeaten. Sachin Tendulkar's century in 2008 chasing 387 runs was also special. IPL matches were delightful, colourful.  The TIE test in 1986 against Aussies.

Name: Prem Kumar
Title: Chepauk
Review: The M A Chidambaram stadium is better known as chepauk and is one of the oldest cricket stadiums in the country. Now the home ground of Chennai super kings franchise. It is known for some classic matches India vs Pakistan test match in 1998 and India vs England in 2008 and few more memorable matches are played here. The stadium got renovated lately to make sure some breeze flows though it.The crowd in chennai is known to be one of the most knowledgeable crowd in the country.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: One of the world famous Land marks of Chennai
Review: This is the place of cricket lovers of India..This stadium bears many memorable moments of Indian Cricketers..Nothing more to be said since anything said about this place could be a drop less than the facts known to other cricket loving fans..

Name: Deadman17
Title: Chepauk
Review: The M A Chidambaram stadium is better known as chepauk and is one of the oldest cricket stadiums in the country. The stadium is also host of the Chennai Super Kings one of the biggest franchises of the IPL. The stadium has couple of new stands which are brilliant to sit and enjoy the matches. One can also go through the history of the evolution of the cricket in the region.

Name: satyajitjadhav
Title: Famous ground in India but old.
Review: The stadium is located close to the marina beach and is located in crowded place. I visited during IPL. This is an old stadium. Cricket lover will visit this CSK home ground.

Name: Pallavan
Title: ipl cricket
Review: on 9th of this month I went for an opl match with my family to this stadium.was great experience watching with 1000 of people with so much noise stadium was beautiful and pleasant. people really enjoyed and it was like a festival. like to go again.

Name: Karpagavalli
Title: Famous stadium
Review: The stadium is famous and loved by most of the locals since they were crazy over cricket game.this is near the famous,longest marina beach and visitors were allowed only on the match days and ofcourse the entry is by a paid ticket.

Name: Narasimhan G
Title: Stunning space for Cricket
Review: Cricketeres' paradiseVery near  to EMUChepauk  is reachable by bus as wellAwait serious cricketStadium Cricket performance is good to watch

Name: krazikams
Title: Home ground of CSK
Review: Ever since the IPL started, I try to watch atleast 1 match here featuring the local Chennai Super Kings team. The atmosphere is just electric and full of energy. Just that they need to improve facilities for public like hygienic toilets and drinking water. Also, in-house snacks are very expensive and we cannot carry food from outside. Also, big chaos and queue for parking. So, if they improve these things, it will become convenient for public and cricket lovers.

Name: kvramani
Title: Grand Old Cricket Stadium of Chennai.
Review: 1. Located in the center of Chennai, it is a historical place for the game of cricket in Chepauk.2. Many great giants and masters of Cricket have played here.3. This ground has seen some of the fine moments of the game, including clasiic Tie of a Test match.4. Green field with new modern stand can seat about 45000 spectators.5. Title: Not an attraction

Name: Praveenop
Title: The Hallowed spot of Indian cricket
Review: This international cricket stadium has seen the greatest ( I mean the greatest test match) moments of history were made here. The present stadium looks truly beautiful but  it  has not been completed for a few years now. If this project is completed the stadium would be a marvel. MS Dhoni has taken active interest in designing the stadium so  that the bowlers and the batsmen could take advantage of the evening breeze. It was designed in such a way that the breeze from the Marina beach would breeze pass through the gaps in the stands to the gorund. It still has some issues with the authorities over civil permissions. In Spite of all this the stadium is one of the best looking stadium in India and internationally.

Name: ramchabi
Title: Great iconic stadium
Review: It is the oldest continuously used cricket stadium in the country. It is also the home of CSK. The place doesn’t have much parking and so it is best reached by public transport or by taxis.  The food available is okay and you can’t get alcohol at the stadium. The box is a comfortable place to watch the game but the best place is outside.

Name: reddi_traveller
Title: M.A.Chidambaram Stadium
Review: Avoid visiting a game during a sunny day because of the heat and humidity since it is near to the sea. and the stadium is renovated recently as i heard from many of my chennai friends.

Name: Paloma_Rao
Title: Super
Review: One of my favourite cricket venues in India! It may not be the fanciest but it is certainly iconic. Also since it's close to the beach, you get a nice sea breeze! Keeps things pleasant!

Name: vijmail99

Name: SrikamakshiS

The chennai crowd is always sportive and give a standing ovation to all performers even if it is India or any other country. The mexican wave is a nice thing to experience here. Things to improve: food spread and a bit of cleanliness needs to be taken care of. The beach is close by. So the stadium might get windy at times.

Name: vikasmardia
Title: cricket
Review: cricket stadium m a Chidambaram or chepauk is located very near to famous marina beach. one of the finest cricket grounds in india.

Name: Joji J
Title: "Venue of several Cricket Matches"
Review: It's something great that such a big stadium is maintained in the city but the effort is worth since a cricket match is announced here and the stadium becomes the talk of the world. The stadium is maintained properly with all facilities and built to accomodate about 50000 people to watch a cricket test or match. The stadium is a regular venue for cricket matches and have food outlets, proper entry, rooms for players and dignitaries etc. Though I have been to the stadium several times I have just seen only an IPL Match here.

Name: Arun K
Title: Cricket at its best !!
Review: My first visit here was an India-Australia test match and it was simply awesome. The match was headed for a nail biting finish on the 5th day (which sadly got washed out).Also been here for a few IPL matches.The stadium experience is simply different with crazy shouting and cheering.However, the seating is not entirely appropriate since there is literally no ventilation. You will be left sweating profusely.

Name: Nchantedtraveller
Title: Nice grounds in the middle of busy Chennai city
Review: A stadium with a lot of cricket history. Cricket fans will enjoy a visit here even if there is no game. I watched a Test cricket game between India and England last year from air-conditioned club house. Very pleasant but the seating could have been better. Plastic deck chairs were not comfortable. The snack and lunch vendors were not good, not very organized to sell to the crowd within the allotted lunch hour. Needs a lot of improvement to belong in the upper categories of sports facilities around the world.

Name: tafayyaz
Title: Nice Place for tourist and sports lover.
Review: One of the old and famous cricket stadium of India. The overall management for players and spectators are excellent.

Name: Bob R
Title: It could be so good but..
Review: This is  a very attractive ground but, unfortunately, legal rows mean half the stands are not used. Seating was comfortable, a miracle given that just a couple of days before it had been strewn all over the stadium by a cyclone. Entry is chaotic, not helped by our gate being next to the open sewer/polluted watercourse that runs along one side of the ground - its best to breathe through your mouth. Reasonable selection of food on offer but water only available in paper cups which the vendors handle insides of with hands they use for the money. You cannot bring bottled water in yourself.There were more security and ticket checks than I have ever had including boarding international flights.

Name: Anand G
Title: Hunting Ground for Indian Spinners
Review: The stadium is one of the best cricket stadiums in the country. Famous for the spinner friendly pitch, it had traditionally been a hunting ground for Indian spinners. A visit at any point of time evokes memories of great performances by heroes of cricket, Indian or otherwise.

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Cricketing zone
Review: Home to CSK, this ground has hosted many famous and historic cricket matches. Renovated few years back, it offers nice view of cricket action in middle even from top rows. Very near to Beach.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Awesome stadium
Review: Located within city, this cricket stadium offers best sporting entertainment during IPL and has hosted several International matches as well. Recently renovated, it looks majestic, however, due to stand-off with Corporation, few stands have been sealed off.

Name: Snowyontour
Title: Iconic ground - shame half of it was shut due to dodgy planning permission!
Review: We were there for the fifth Test and were fortunate enough to see a good part of the ground. Sadly half of the stadium was shut due to the fact (we were told) that three stands had been built without planning permission.Would recommend a visit - maybe to a Chennai Super Kings game - if they ever return to the IPL - they were banned due to "irregularities" sadly something that seems to plague cricket in the sub continent.

Name: ErnieGodalming
Title: Basic stadium
Review: Not the greatest stadium that I have been to with half the ground out of commission due to planning and construction difficulties. seating comprised old plastic bucket seats with tie straps. The ground was having to cope with a recnet cyclone but was filthy and overwhelming stench from the Buckingham canal was at times overpowering and food should be avoided as one person from our hotel ate the doughnuts on offer and was hospitalised. The cricket did provide plenty of the right runs, however.

Name: oaksfield
Title: Indian Bureaucracy at its best!
Review: Went to see the text match cricket in December 2016.  They wouldn't sell tickets to anyone until the actual day.  People were coming out at 'tea' and not being let back in despite valid ticket.  Had to queue from 6am to get ticket for 1 day.  Three sections not uses as apparently they didn't have necessary permissions to build them so couldn't use them.  The bureaucracy was diabolical, the stadium was only half full (at best) but they still didn't want to sell tickets.  Seats near the river had an over powering 'odour' ..... try to get seats up wind of these!  Such a pity they couldn't get their act together, very bad publicity for the country. Sadly England didn't do well either - but it was great watching the match.

Name: Elaine
Title: Attractive stadium but could be so much better
Review: First of all, congratulations to the ground staff who got this stadium ready to host a test match just days after the cyclone had caused such devastation.We were in the main pavilion area with views of the attractive individual stands. However three of these are not used due to a Supreme Court ruling about planning permission and therefore detracts from the overall experience of sight and atmosphere.Our seating was plastic chairs cable tied together. Quite comfortable but far to many in each row obstructing the steps and no clear path between sections and the stairs.Considering the ground was half empty there was no need for this.Leaving the stand in a hurry would be almost impossible as there's only one exit to channel through.There were plenty of food and drink stalls with good prices. But drinks were served in paper cups, no bottles allowed. I prefer a bottle so I can keep sipping rather than drinking it all in one go.Security was shambolic and inconsistent which was frustrating.A nice stadium (please open all the stands).I enjoyed my visit.

Name: shrinikethv
Title: Needs to be organized better
Review: Recently visited this stadium for 5th test, India vs England. Stadium has improved a lot, getting much better. But three stands are currently useless which is a pathetic sight. Something has to be done to ensure these 3 stands are in use. The pricing of food inside the staidum is nearly twice as the MRP, which is too much!

Name: blueandy1mac
Title: Much improved
Review: Looks a great stadium but needs to pass local planning requirements before 3 of its stands can be used again. Strangely they were in use for thee WC in 2011.

Name: APK24
Title: Enjoyed a day at the cricket!
Review: I visited recently for the India v England test match that took place here. The ground was in good condition inspite of the cyclone that lashed the city earlier in the month. I had a great fun day at the cricket. However i strongly recommend taking public transport or a cab to the ground as parking is an issue

Name: ChrisJS51
Title: Shambolic organisation and poor facilitiews
Review: We watched the Fifth Test Match between India and England. Some highlights (or lowlights):- Two huge new stands were completely empty. This apparently is because of a dispute between the owner (who believes he is a law unto himself) and the local planning authorities who want him to pull the stands down- We arrived with tickets telling us to enter at Gate 10. Stewards gate 120 told us to go to Gate 11. Stewards at gate 11 told us to go to gate 10. They eventually got this sorted out on the second day- Most days, prospective spectators were being turned away on the basis that the ground was full. In fact, not only were the stands mentioned above completely empty, but none of the others were much more than half-full either- The stadium appears to be staffed entirely by contractors who have never worked at the place before and don't know how it should be run- The TVs in our air-conditioned box were almost completely invisible as the box was south-facing and the screens were in front of us - so the glare was overpowering- Access to the box was via one lift which took 12 people, and two staircases which ran from the ground floor to the fourth. The fourth was one floor above us, and provided open seating and ad hoc catering facilities. Both staircases were almost permanently locked (except for exit at the end of the day), and lift access to the fourth floor was disabled. To support this, the lift contained an operator who sat on a stool all day (taking up two spaces in the lift) and did nothing but press the buttons, and two security guards who sat all day by the locked gates to the staircases doing nothing. This was apparently done to stop people without tickets for our air-conditioned floor gaining access to it. The consequences were that: (1) the only access during the day in or out of our box (which sat several hundred people) was via one lift which took ten people; (2) to get up one floor for the catering or for an outside view, we had to go down in the lift to the ground floor then walk up four flights; (3) there was a massive fire risk. When our tour group leader remonstrated with the authorities about the fire risk, they said it was OK because in the event of fire the man with the key would come and open the locked gates (if you believe that you'll believe anything). We suggested that the security guards on the staircases unlock the gates and actually check tickets - this would be better than having them sat down all day next to a locked gate doing nothing - but we were ignored. Our tour guide contemplated taking us all out of the box for safety reasons, but it would have been quite obvious that the authorities would have done nothing about it and we simply wouldn't have been able to watch the cricket.

Name: jaytara
Title: Pompous staff
Review: Paid Rs 4000/- for a season ticket to watch the cricket Test in Dec 2016. Seats were fine, but the security was over the top, they wouldn't allow anything in, not even newspapers, and one had to buy overpriced and mediocre stuff inside. The bigwigs sat happily in the pavilion with nary a care. Chennai should not stage Test matches, the stadium is as bad as the airport.

Name: vignesh d
Title: Lords of Tamilnadu
Review: This stadium has its own history, many remarkable matches played here, been there  once to witness a IPL match. The two tiers are not allowed some case is pending. its great experience to see the match with the whole crowd.

Name: Nathaniel
Title: Knowledgeable Cricket fans are from Chennai
Review: The atmosphere is electrifying and is a must experience if you are on vacation and in Chennai. The fans cheering , the bands playing and the loud cheers when the famous stars like Kohli, Dravid come out to bat is just mind blowing. #natnzin

Name: VIVEK V

Review: the oldest stadium in tamilnadu. This is the first fully covered stadium in tamilnadu . Though it is big, it is neatly maintained

Name: Manoj T
Title: Cricket stadium
Review: Only cricket stadium here in chennai . Landmark placce near the beach .Late night stroll to be avoided

Name: EshwarSaba
Title: Flush Green Outfield
Review: With the Tamilnadu Premier League (TNPL) going on, went to watch one of the matches. Got a seat at the pavilion terrace right behind the sight screen. Hmmm! what a view one gets of the pitch, and the players with the match being played under flood lights. The ambience was electrifying what with all the cheer leaders, the music between each over and the game itself. The out field is lush green and if it is a full house then it will add to the atmosphere. Great place to watch a nice cricket match.

Name: Prabhu P
Title: Lion's Den
Review: Have been thrice to MAC for enjoying the Chennai Super Kings' roaring at the Den. Also for a great International ODI when the 2 Current best ODI batsman of the world scored centuries on the same day. Virat Kohli & ABD.

Name: Rajesh C
Title: Spectacular Stadium
Review: The MAC is a beautiful venue to watch cricket. The views are fantastic and the greens are worth the trip. It's easily one of the best stadiums to watch cricket in India. Scoreboards are well placed but there is only one big screen TV to watch the replays. Generally, snacks are served but they are not as hot/cold as you would prefer. The food court areas are always a mess and untidy and the toilets suck. Note that you would not be allowed to take any food items inside the stadium during matches - and that's just to make you buy the local fare available there at an exorbitant cost. Please be seated well in advance (30-60 mins) for the matches. In most cases, there are no seat numbers and you may end up standing for the entire duration of a match.Having said all this, there is no comparison to watching a match on TV and experiencing the match live on the grounds. It's an experience like no other.

Name: Niya1315
Title: Nice Stadium
Review: It is a big stadium and easily approachable with public transport. Marina beach is also nearby. The ground is lush green and it is having good sitting facility. A good stadium for playing cricket.

Title: Best Stadium

A sore sight was that three stands in the stadium had to be empty due to an ongoing litigation with the corporation authorities.All said and done, one of the appreciated cricket stadiums in India to witness a cricket match.

Name: itsjusamit
Title: an excellent atmosphere welcomes all at this place
Review: I found this cricket stadium a real nice place were people come to watch  a real good game of cricket.

Name: saagar49
Title: Excellent Match
Review: I went to the Match between india vs south africa 4th odi , it was huge crowd that day , i was standing for 30 minutes to enter in to stadium , then match started , i enjoyed virat kohli batting , he got a century , most important thing , india won that game.

Name: Begaraaj S M
Title: Stupendofantabulous Stadium !!!

Name: sandy0028

Name: kathiranand7
Title: Nice stadium...

Review: You can't get a better place to play or watch cricket than the MAC. The pitch is usually sporting having something for the bowlers and the batsmen. Name: AshokMela
Title: Best Cricket stadium !!!
Review: Enjoyed watching India playing South Africa at M.A.Chidambaram stadium also called chepauk stadium. Very beautiful stadium close to Marina beach. Easily accessible through MRTS train or bus. Water bottles, bags not allowed. Suitable for organizing Day and Night games.

Name: Mathivanan V
Title: Entry only for Members and Spectators
Review: This is not a Tourist attraction or a place to See.This is a Cricket stadium where world class matches are played.If you are in this city and by chance any match is played at the time of ur visit,you can pretty well go and  buy ticket (if you can get)  and enjoy.A very well maintained stadium with all amenities

Name: ROYKALYAN
Title: Awesome Stadium
Review: A great new stadium also called Chepauk Stadium , very near to Marina Beach and Chennai Central Railway Station . The popular IPL matches which are normally played in flood lights in late evenings are spectacular to view,

Name: SagarVS
Title: For Cricket lovers
Review: This stadium is the biggest in Chennai and hosts cricket matches. TN Cricket association and the Madras Cricket club are both here and entry is for members only. No need to visit unless there is a match or event happening.

Name: GrubWaz
Title: Great new stadium, awesome crowd.
Review: After the renovation, finally there is space for air to come into the stands. From being a stuffy cricket ground, MAC has become a fabulous place to watch cricket from. Add to it, the crowd touted as the most sportive crowd in the cricketing world which gave a standing ovation to Pakistan when they beat India, MAC is a blessing for cricket.

Name: Capri67
Title: Cricket - MAC Chepauk - Synonyms!
Review: Nothing to beat an International Cricket Match in Namma MAC, Chepauk Stadium! Many a nostalgic memories stand out. The 136 by great Sachin against a rampaging Pakistan is till date probably the best innings played under immense pressure and personal duress in this stadium. Over the years, this has changed with newer stands but the old nostalgia still remains whenever I visit this place!

Name: s_ramsam
Title: Excellent stadium
Review: This stadium which is an excellent piece of construction in the heart of the old city is mainly for cricket lovers since all cricket matches are held here.  Very accessible from other areas in the city, this is also probably the best sports stadium in southern India.

Name: AbhishekKalra
Title: Great experience
Review: Went to the stadium for an IPL match as part of team outing. The stadium is a gigantic structure and stands outs in its vicinity. A few pointers from my experiences1) Carefully designed stutcture with keen eye on the saftey (Multiple exits)2) Multi level Seating (With the VIP box on the lower floor)3) Well lit4) Beautifully curated field5) Multiple Exit gates6) Convenient Location (Right in the centre of the city)Despite all the ups as mentioned above the place does comes wiht its own flaws1) Disturbing Empty stands (caught up in some legal mess)2) Crowded surroundings (might hamper during emergency)Bottomline: Just go and enjoy the game (Surreal Experience (First game in a stadium))

Name: VenkyV
Title: One of the star attractions of Chennai
Review: If you are in Chennai during the IPL season or International Cricket season, checkout the MAC Stadium. This is a real concrete jungle, but the atmosphere can be electric when CSK or India plays.

Name: girieshm24
Title: Match in chennai
Review: a gift for cricket fans in chennai the IPL is the main season and the crowd is over sprited and you can enjoy the game

Name: Baskar_Raman
Title: Amazing experience
Review: The biggest cricket stadium in Chennai with good access from different roads leading to it. Watched a couple of IPL matches and enjoyed the experience

Name: ppnpower
Title: Arena  for cricket
Review: historical & well maintained, festive place for great cricket matches, international standard ground. located in city center & close to central railway station
